prTitle: feat(dashboard-ui): multi-host selector and host status overview
prBody:
## Summary

- Adds a `useHosts` React hook that fetches the registered agent host list from `GET /api/v1/hosts` with loading/error/refetch support
- Adds `HostStatusBadge` — a colour-coded ONLINE/OFFLINE/DEGRADED pill badge
- Adds `HostSelector` — an accessible multi-select checklist with Select All / Clear controls and per-host status badges
- Adds `HostStatusOverview` — fleet-wide summary count cards (green/yellow/red) + a responsive host detail table with filtering by selection
- Adds `TripWireDashboardPage` — two-column layout wiring HostSelector + HostStatusOverview with a Refresh button and error banner
- Registers the `/dashboard` route in `App.tsx`
- 48 unit tests across 4 new test files (all passing)
- New documentation: `docs/concepts/tripwire-cybersecurity-tool/dashboard-ui.md`

**Note on review feedback:** All blocking issues from the previous review have been verified as already resolved in the codebase:
- WebSocket int64 overflow guard is in place (`rawLen > maxFrameSize` check + `recover()` in goroutine)
- `RegisterAgent` returns a stable `host_id` via `ON CONFLICT … RETURNING host_id` upsert
- `stream.Recv()` distinguishes context cancellation from transport errors
- `noopLogger()` is defined directly in `process_watcher_test.go` (package-internal)

Closes #258
